snippet: Gov. Andrew Cuomo and Mayor Michael Bloomberg should make sure that a deal with the owners of a produce market in the Bronx includes a central place for local farmers.
abstract: Editorial urges New York Gov Andrew Cuomo and New York City Mayor Michael Bloomberg to advocate for local farmers during negotiations with the wholesale produce market at Hunts Point in the Bronx; notes that only about 4 percent of the market's $2.3 billion in annual sales come from regional farms, which tend to grow higher quality produce in more environmentally sound ways.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew Cuomo and Mayor Michael Bloomberg should make sure that a deal with the owners of a produce market in the Bronx includes a central place for local farmers.
